subject: Re: @finally
msgSnippet: ... that is ... occurred. ... can be ... Constructors ... you can ... test ... of ... That s a good job .initialization block only another badly way As Lasse
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...>
wrote:
>
> Hi Saurav, Hi "hyysguyang",
>
> On 7/30/07, hyysguyang <hyysguyang@...> wrote:
> >
> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "sauravkr" <sauravkr@> wrote:
> > >
> > > I expect another annotation in apart from @before and @After
that is
> > > @Finally. That should behave like finally and can be used for
> > valuable
> > > work like closing file or IO in case of exception has
occurred.
> > >
> > > Also, I want some annotation instead of @beforeClass which
can be
> > > applied for non static method and called only once as
Constructors
> > > are called in normal java.
> >
> > If you want some method called only once as Constructors are
you can
> > try the instantial blok statement.
> > e.g:
> > public class Person(){
> > private String name;
> >
> > {
> > initName();
> > }
> >
> > public void initName(){this.name="init name...";}
> > }
>
> I would recommend avoiding using the initialization block for any
test
> setup/teardown because it is not guaranteed that the same instance
of
> a test class is going to be reused throughout all tests.
>
> Go with @Before/@After instead.
>
> Lasse
>
> --
> Lasse Koskela
> * Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
> * Reaktor Innovations * http://www.ri.fi/en *
>

That's a good job .initialization block only another badly way

As Lasse say go with @Before/@After instead.
